input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is IBMTSMActor

Sample items xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>stop-scheduler</operation-name> <scheduler-name>sch1</scheduler-name> </item>
<item> <operation-name>stop-scheduler</operation-name> <scheduler-name>sch2</scheduler-name> </item>
<item> <operation-name>stop-scheduler</operation-name> <scheduler-name></scheduler-name> </item>
<item> <operation-name>stop-scheduler</operation-name> </item>
</items>
Elements' Description
item [Required]: This is a child of items element. Within this element you can specify the name of the scheduler you want to stop. The item element can be used multiple time to stop more than one scheduler at the same time.
operation-name [Optional]: the operation to be performed.
Valid value: stop-scheduler Default value: stop-scheduler
Note: this tag is 'Required' tag while executing request from CRUD level wrapper 'Perform Action'.
scheduler-name [Optional]: Specifies the name of the scheduler you want to stop. If you do not specify this element within the <item> tag, the default scheduler is stoped. This tag is relevant for 'Windows' opeating system only. For other operating systems we don't need to specify the scheduler name.
Valid value: Any valid scheduler name.
Default value: TSM Client Scheduler(Only for Windows OS)

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">stop-scheduler</xsl:text> </operation-name> <timeout-secs> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">5</xsl:text> </timeout-secs> <command-options> <xsl:copy-of select="./scheduler-name" /> </command-options> </item> </xsl:for-each> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
